sub_title: Senior ESG Manager | Real Assets | MBA
summary:
I have a passion to successfully lead and deliver projects that answer complex and challenging problems, with a recent focus on energy and sustainability and project and programme management.  I am client focused, driven and also possess the technical, managerial and team skills required to deliver.

My recent experience includes:
- City and Municipal Carbon Policy
- Corporate Sustainability Strategy and Implementation
- Energy and Resource Masterplanning
- Low Carbon Energy Systems (City and Building Scale)
- Green Building Design
- Programme Management Office (PMO) and ecoPMO
- Real Estate Strategy and Operational Business Cases
- Real Estate Building Due Diligence
- Financial Modelling / Analysis
- Business Development

I have worked across a range of industries with large global corporations and government organizations across the Americas, UKMEA and Asia-Pacific.   Sample clients include: 
- Financial Services: Deutsche Bank, Credit Suisse, Mitsui Investment Bank, St George Bank, UBS Investment Bank
- Real Estate: Tishman Speyer, Grosvenor Group, JBG Companies, Jonathon Rose Companies, Corporate Offices Property Trust
- Industry: InterContinental Hotels Group, Siemens, GE, Astrazeneca, 
- Education/Arts: Columbia University, The Lincoln Centre of Performing Arts, The New York Metropolitan Opera, Georgia Tech University, Washington University St Louis
- Government/Cities: US Department of State, City of Cambridge, City of Toronto, Greater London Authority, NYC Metropolitan Transportation Authority, King Abdullah City for Atomic and Renewable Energy, Australian Taxation Office
- Not for Profits: C40 Cities, Clinton Climate Positive, the Garden Bridge Trust, Conservation Volunteers Australia

education.degree_name: IMD - APG Investment Management Leadership Programme 2022

education.field_of_study: Mechanical Engineering / Commerce - Exchange Semester Abroad

projects.title: Georgetown Energy Masterplan, Toronto, Canada

contributors.headline: Senior ESG Manager | Real Assets | MBA

projects.title: Grosvenor Estates Project Delivery Review, Great Britain and Ireland
projects.description: I developed a bespoke Project Delivery Framework for one of the UKs largest property developers.  The goal was to capture all current client project delivery policies, processes and procedures, substitute with best practice where required and rollout in a short timeframe.  More detailed tasks included a detailed review and gap analysis of existing delivery documentation; workshops around key development areas such as governance, risk management and procurement; the creation of new tools & templates, development of the full manual and finally the successful rollout and training to over 100 client staff.

contributors.headline: Senior ESG Manager | Real Assets | MBA

projects.title: Siemens District Energy Study

contributors.headline: Senior ESG Manager | Real Assets | MBA

projects.title: Toronto’s 80x50 Carbon Reduction Plan
projects.description: I worked with Sustainability Solutions Group (SSG) and Whatif Modelling to develop Toronto’s 80x50 plan.  I recommended a range of strategies across the categories of energy efficiency in buildings, energy supply, food & agriculture, land use, transport, waste, water, finance & economic development and education/community engagement.

contributors.headline: Senior ESG Manager | Real Assets | MBA

projects.title: Decentralised Energy Project Delivery Unit (DEPDU), North London Waste Authority, London
projects.description: I was the was the DEPDU Project Manager for the feasibility analysis of the 17 MWth North London energy centre retrofit to provide heat to the Lea Valley Heat Network.  This project was one of London’s largest and involved development of critical milestones for all key stakeholders; schematic design of the retrofit; detailed technical, and later commercial, advice for negotiations between the waste authority and the heat network; carbon and lifecycle cost analysis to ensure viability and the facilitation of numerous alignment meetings to work through snags and keep to the tight schedule.

contributors.headline: Senior ESG Manager | Real Assets | MBA

projects.title: UKMEA and Global Programme Management Office (PMO) - Global Financial Services Organisation
projects.description: My main project involves providing a comprehensive suite of Programme Management Office (PMO) services to an international financial services organization. I am the UKMEA lead, managing over €150 million in projects annually. I also support the Global PMO which manages over €400 million annually. The role includes continual governance monitoring and high level reporting up to Managing Director level within the organization. i interact with a range of client stakeholders within the bank, other service delivery lines and also manages numerous project managers, cost consultants, architects and contractors to ensure the effective, efficient and compliant delivery of projects.

contributors.headline: Senior ESG Manager | Real Assets | MBA

projects.title: Programme Management Office (PMO) - Global Retail Bank
projects.description: My main project involved providing a comprehensive suite of Programme Management Office (PMO) services to an international retail bank. I was the international lead for the PMO team, managing over €100 million in current projects and another €60 million in the pipeline. In this role I prepared a range of high level reports for the main client and project board, interacted with client staff on a day-to-day basis, managed other international PMO personnel around the globe, provided a full suite of strategic PMO advice and developed key financial models and processes that helped to streamline the PMO operation.

contributors.headline: Senior ESG Manager | Real Assets | MBA

projects.title: LEED Best Practice - Global Financial Services Organisation
projects.description: This project involved developing a Project LEED Best Practice Manual along with organizational implementation suggestions.  I was the lead consultant and conducted interviews of client project managers worldwide; synthesized data to determine best practice credits and lessons learnt; developed implementation suggestions and presented findings to the client.

contributors.headline: Senior ESG Manager | Real Assets | MBA

projects.title: Sustainable Building Design - B2-1, R1, R7 and H1, Yongsan Masterplan, South Korea
projects.description: Of 20 planned skyscrapers for the iconic Yongsan Masterplan in South Korea Arup was involved in SMEP design for eight of them.  I was lead consultant for all four buildings run from the NY office and helped advise the other four.  This project involved both LEED coordination with aspirations for Gold certification and the modeling of supply side strategies (PV, GSHP, Natural gas fuel cells, etc) to meet stringent local standards in terms of percentage of peak energy, annual consumption and construction cost.

contributors.headline: Senior ESG Manager | Real Assets | MBA

projects.title: Sustainable Design - New US London Embassy, UK
projects.description: This project involved providing mechanical and sustainability input for the design of the new 50,000 sqm US London Embassy. I was the sustainability lead and worked to develop a comprehensive water, energy and carbon neutral strategy using a variety of analytical methods. This involved using engineering and financial modeling to recommend various sustainable initiatives including, but not limited to, a combined heat and power plant, solar PV, black water treatment, rainwater collection and integrated cooling ponds. I also worked to design the building to meet the environmental benchmarks of LEED Platinum and BREEAM Outstanding.

contributors.headline: Senior ESG Manager | Real Assets | MBA

projects.title: Energy Conservation Strategy - COPT Office of the Future, USA
projects.description: This project involved developing a detailed energy conservation strategy to be incorporated into COPT’s 12,000 sqm, LEED Platinum “Office of the Future” in Maryland, USA.  I was the lead consultant and coordinated all energy modeling, financial analysis and client deliverables.

contributors.headline: Senior ESG Manager | Real Assets | MBA

projects.title: Energy Supply Strategy - King Abdullah City for Atomic and Renewable Energy (KA-CARE), Riyadh, Saudi Arabia
projects.description: This competition involved a masterplan development of a new city in Saudi Arabia with a vision to foster atomic and renewable energy research.  I worked on both the energy supply side and HVAC systems.  Key research was undertaken into cutting edge technologies such as nuclear, geothermal, solar tower, waste power and energy storage.  HVAC systems were also designed to minimize energy use and take into account stringent on-site conditions.

contributors.headline: Senior ESG Manager | Real Assets | MBA

projects.title: Carbon Calculator - Toronto Waterfront Redevelopment Corporation, Canada
projects.description: Toronto Waterfront and the Clinton Climate Initiative approached Arup to develop a comprehensive carbon calculator for the planned Toronto Waterfront redevelopment.  Energy, water, waste, materials, transport and land use were all factored into a detailed carbon model.  I developed the underlying model hierarchy, various model sections and the user friendly “front end” output pages.  This model has since been utilized on a variety of projects by the TWRC and rolled out a universal carbon master planning calculator by the Clinton Climate Initiative.

contributors.headline: Senior ESG Manager | Real Assets | MBA

projects.title: Energy Conservation Strategy - JBG Real Estate Group, USA
projects.description: This project involved developing a detailed energy conservation strategy to be incorporated into JBG’s new design and construction projects totaling 30% building energy reduction.  The primary focus was on a 60,000 sqm building in Washington DC.  I was the lead consultant and conducted all energy modeling, financial analysis, document development and presentations to the client’s executive committee.

contributors.headline: Senior ESG Manager | Real Assets | MBA

projects.title: LEED Strategy - IQ Tower, Qatar
projects.description: For the design of Industries Qatar Petroleum’s 86 floor, 60,000 sqm trademark tower in Doha Qatar I managed all LEED aspects of the project.  This involved communicating with engineers across the Americas and the middle east to facilitate proper LEED design protocol and gathering and reviewing required documentation for LEED submittal.

contributors.headline: Senior ESG Manager | Real Assets | MBA

projects.title: Sustainability Guidelines - IHG Hotels Group
projects.description:
The first phase of this project involved the development of a framework to guide sustainable practices in the hotel industry backed by detailed energy and financial analyses of various sustainability measures.  I developed and managed the financial modelling side of these measures which were the backbone for company’s decision criteria worldwide.

The second phase of the project was the development of an automated Energy Conservation Measure toolkit which allowed hotel users to input key parameters, select applicable energy measures and then see the associated energy and financial savings.  This toolkit was rolled out globally through an online portal and these measures were shown to save 10-25% of the organisations operating costs.  I was the lead consultant and modeller on this job.

contributors.headline: Senior ESG Manager | Real Assets | MBA

projects.title: Business Continuity Management - Large Public Sector Client, Australia
projects.description: For a large public sector client Cameron worked to develop a robust Business Continuity Management (BCM) Program. I managed his own work stream, conducted over 30 interviews of client staff to determine key interdependencies; mapped over 600 business processes to a customized generic value chain for scenario impact analysis and undertook detailed gap analysis of the client’s current capabilities against best practice.

contributors.headline: Senior ESG Manager | Real Assets | MBA

projects.title: Energy and Water Strategy - Jonathon Rose Companies, USA
projects.description: This project involved developing a detailed excel-based energy and water model to allow for year-on-year shareholder reporting. This model allowed for easy evaluation of sustainability implemented measures within key facilities. I researched, developed and re-iterated this model to allow for easy client utilization.

contributors.headline: Senior ESG Manager | Real Assets | MBA

projects.title: Future Distribution Strategy - Australian Financial Services Company
projects.description: This project involved developing a future distribution strategy aligned with key brand points for a leading Australian Financial Services Company. I developed a baseline economics model; undertook detailed high value customer analytics; facilitated numerous client interviews; undertook mystery shopping across competitors and prepared detailed documents for presentation to the executive committee.

profile_positions.description: Developed go-to-market strategies and initial publications for two new BNEF growth areas - industrial robotics and advanced materials - for the emerging technologies team.  BNEF is a research organisation that helps corporate strategy, finance and policy professionals navigate change and generate opportunities.  BNEF covers clean energy, advanced transport, digital industry, innovative materials and commodities.
profile_positions.title: MBA Summer Analyst

profile_positions.description:
For the Business Call to Action's (BCtA) Business Impact Measurement Service (BIMS) conducted interviews, carried out online surveys and undertook analysis to determine user satisfaction, business and customer impact, lessons learned and improvements for the service.  The report will be co-published with the UN and summarised in the UK Guardian.

Launched at the United Nations in 2008, Business Call to Action (BCtA) aims to accelerate progress towards the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) by challenging companies to develop inclusive business models that engage people at the base of the economic pyramid (BoP) as consumers, producers, suppliers, distributors of goods and services and employees.
